pullRequest.body:
Adds lemmas about what `optionEquivRight`/`optionEquivLeft` evaluates to.

---

nodes.body: Ok done, but I don't know how to remove the rfl from the last one like you did.

Ok I did this but I guess simp already proves some of those lemmas.

Looking into this I am a little mystified. We have this relevant lemma [Polynomial.C_eq_algebraMap](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/AlgebraMap.html#Polynomial.C_eq_algebraMap). But shouldn't that lemma be turned around and marked as `simp`?

Edit: I made #11193 to investigate further

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11193~~

```suggestion
  simp only [Option.elim, AlgEquiv.coe_mk, aeval_C, C_eq_algebraMap, algebraMap_apply]
```
